Comment: This is actually worse than top secret.   There are classifications of information in the national security community.   Unclassified, Secret, and Top Secret.   Then there is Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI). This is the “need to know” programs usually related to technologies or collection capabilities.   But what was in this briefing is the most tightly controlled and sensitive information - the Special Access Programs (SAP). SAPs are the most sensitive information and contain fragile intelligence or cutting edge technologies or other extraordinarily sensitive information. It’s the most sensitive of all DOD information.   And they were going to brief Elon on this stuff.

Comment: You don’t know what you’re talking about. This reads like someone who gets their info from Reddit and the internet.   I left out a bunch of nuance for brevity. Waived SAPs do indeed get reported to Congress but only to a very restricted number of Members.   (And it’s “waived” not “waved” because the SECDEF is waiving the requirement to brief all members of the relevant defense committees and only briefing leadership.)  Q is nuclear and has nothing to do with this. So I have no idea why you brought this up - maybe just to make this about UFOs or some shit.

Comment: I'm trying to engage thoughtfully & respectfully.  What are your thoughts on David Grusch's claims, which were shared under oath to the house oversight and armed services committee?  Here's the full hearing if you are un aware: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SNgoul4vyDM  And here's his first public statement to a news network: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RBAISwCZ2v0  And here's the original story: https://thedebrief.org/intelligence-officials-say-u-s-has-retrieved-non-human-craft/  How do we reconcile gang of 8 and (at the time) senate majority leader Chuck Schumer introducing the following legislation, in co-ordiantion with senators Rounds, Gillibrand & Rubio? Why 60 pages of talk of NHI, biologics, crash retrievals?  https://www.democrats.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/schumer-rounds-introduce-new-legislation-to-declassify-government-records-related-to-unidentified-anomalous-phenomena-and-ufos_modeled-after-jfk-assassination-records-collection-act--as-an-amendment-to-ndaa  What do we do with testimony from people like Kirk McConnell, who spent 37 years as a professional staff member of the Senate Armed Services Committee, the Senate Intelligence Committee, the House Intelligence Committee who comes forward and confirms backs up that what people like Grusch are saying was presented to them under oath in classified settings?  Here's Kirk talking on the topic: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KGD1nuM4MR8  I'm genuinely curious, how do we square these circles? Are these just some high level former military & intel officials coming forward and sharing this info for fun, and perjuring themselves under oath?
Author: poetry-linesman

Author: poetry-linesman

Comment: >You gave me links to news sites and interviews that are alien/ufo sites.  They're not "ufo/alien":  * News Nation: owned by the same parent company which owns "The Hill" and is the largest local news organisation in the US - Nexstar News. Hardly fringe * The Debrief: Hardly a "ufo/alien" website, did you check their homepage? [https://thedebrief.org/](https://thedebrief.org/) * Sentat Democrats: ... I don't think I need to say anymore on this one.  And then for the Youtube links:  * CBS News coverage of the House oversight & armed services committee hearing with Grusch * A channel with a 3 hour interview with McConnell  >And Kirk once tried to get me to buy technology from the Russians that he said could detect submarines just by looking at the top of the ocean and he was very convincing in the way he made it sound but it wasn’t real. So…  This is a form of ad-hominem, it goes like this: based on your claim he made a mistake, all assertions by him are devalued, including the universe of claims he makes which are outside of your own knowledge set.  I take your point that it is a major datapoint for you, reliability is a thing and first-hand experience of a lack of reliability is valuable - I'm not trying to undermine you. But it also does't discredit his whole position or potential, does it?  (But interesting anecdote, none the less 😉 - I hope you didn't dox yourself un-necessarily)  >I’ll ask you this - if these programs exist then there are thousands of people working on them. Think of how many people work on the B2 or submarine programs - and that classified data leaks.  Compartmentalisation & stove piping - taking your claims at face value, I assume you're more than familiar than this?  How many people were aware of what they were working on in the Manhattan Project, I think something like 12? That project was tens of thousands IIRC?  And also, what do you think all of the above is, people like Grusch, Elizondo, Mellon, Jake Barber, and the many others who have come forward over the years, if not leaks?  The nature of stovepiping & compartmentalisation implicitly protects from catastrophic leaks because so few have access to the material to form the coup de grace leak you seem to be referring to.  >Try finding sources that aren’t from the “I want to believe” crew.  How about we start with this NASA sponsored podcast on the topic of anti-gravitics and other advanced techonologies.  [https://www.shoshinworks.com/podcast-episodes/beyond-conventional-physics-extended-electrodynamics-lattice-confinement-fusion-zero-point-energy-advanced-propulsion](https://www.shoshinworks.com/podcast-episodes/beyond-conventional-physics-extended-electrodynamics-lattice-confinement-fusion-zero-point-energy-advanced-propulsion)  >Featured Guests  >\- Dr. Hal Puthoff - EarthTech International  >\- Larry Forsley - Global Energy Corporation  >\- Phillip Lentz - UnSpace  >\- Richard Banduric - Field Propulsion Technologies  >\- Ankur Bhatt - Hoverr Inc.  >\- Dr. Louis DeChiaro - US Navy Surface Warfare Center, Indian Head  >\- Dr. Chance Glenn - Morningbird Space  >\- MK Merrigan – MK Advisors  >\- Rima Oueid – US Department of Energy     >**Key Themes Discussed**  >\- Extended Electrodynamics (EDI) and its applications  >\- Zero-point energy research and potential applications for unlimited power  >\- Advanced propulsion systems and breakthrough propulsion physics  >\- Quantum detection and sensing technologies  >\- The intersection of gravitational physics and electrodynamics  >\- Novel approaches to fusion and energy generation  >\- Materials science and programmable matter  >\- The convergence of theoretical physics and practical engineering

I say "but it's classified" and you say "just like my girlfriend in Canada"...   > You should also ask yourself why people in the scientific and academic communities aren't convinced by these claims. People like you, treating this like a team sport where you need to de-humanise the opposition.  This is not a simple "scientific" revelation, this is spy vs spy working to keep their secrets forever.  What do you think the white house was talking about with respect to classifying "entire fields of phsyics during the cold war"?  https://www.reddit.com/r/singularity/comments/1e5enn2/marc_andreessen_and_ben_horowitz_say_that_when/
Author: poetry-linesman

Comment: Just to be clear, it seems that what you're saying is that until there is evidence, anyone who talks about it is not legitimate.  What if, given the nature of the secret which is being kept, the tools used to keep the secret - what if "talking" is all we have if whistleblowers don't want to find themselves eliminated?  > The pen is mightier than the sword, but only when writing what I like  I understand that this topic, from the outside looks like more bone-headed, conspiracty theorist quackery. My flawed & self-aware response to that is "that's what a topic with 60 years of intentional ridicule and marginalisation would look like".  And I know you're probably thinking "that's very convenient".  So, yes, evidence is absolutely necessary, but that evidence needs the cover of public interest, and public interest without evidence needs the effort of people like Grush, coming forwards with what the Intelligence Community Inspector General deemed as "credible and urgent" in July 2022.  It might not be a craft, or a body, but that is a piece of evidence which if you take the time to asses points you towards the bigger picture here.
Author: poetry-linesman

Comment: >I've been wondering this myself  Keep wondering about it because it's absolutely crucial to understanding the reality we live in versus to the one you want to believe we live in.  It's actually not about teams. It's about epistemology. Do you care if the things you believe are true or not? If you don't, then I can't help you. If you do, then you must base your beliefs on evidence.   The day an alien spacecraft lands on the White House lawn and its occupants step out and address reporters, I'll adjust my beliefs accordingly.
Author: MadRaymer

Comment: Intentional ridicule over the past 60 years might explain public skepticism, but it doesn’t explain the absence of concrete evidence.
Author: MadRaymer

Comment: Unless the purpose of the ridicule was and is to discredit any and all evidence - real OR planted - and therefore obscure the legitimate pathways to extracting the evidence you specifically want?  In that context, who should your ire be directed at, me, or those doing the gate keeping - I'm just calling for the awareness of a population so that as a whole we can get access to the truths. I'm not interested in little green men.  I get that this topic invites a certain snark and superiority towards people like me. I completely understand, I've been the same and done the same.  It's all good - but you maybe you should also know that there are organisations working towards establishing a scientific framework upon which we can all begin to explore it together.  [https://thesolfoundation.org/](https://thesolfoundation.org/)   [https://www.explorescu.org/](https://www.explorescu.org/)   [https://skywatcher.ai/](https://skywatcher.ai/)  We need a society which can have tolerance for people at the fringes, involved in seemingly "untrue" things - because the fringe is where our future lies.
Author: poetry-linesman
